alert.note: Alert for North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 8:16AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CLATSOP AND SOUTHWESTERN PACIFIC COUNTIES THROUGH 845 AM PST... At 815 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Ilwaco, or 7 miles south of Long Beach, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Long Beach, Ilwaco, Seaview, and Chinook. In Washington this includes U. S. Highway 101 between mile markers 2 and 19. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
